sen.j: 藤原 純友（ふじわら の すみとも、寛平5年（893年）? - 天慶4年6月20日 (旧暦)（941年7月21日））は、平安時代の貴族。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sumitomo (893-July 21, 941) was a nobility in the Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Sumitomo (893? -July 21, 941) was the nobility lived in the Heian period.
sen.cmt: ?が訳漏れです。"lived"を追加しました。Nobilityの冠詞をtheに替えました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sumitomo (893? -July 21, 941) was a nobility who lived during the Heian period.
sen.cmt: in→duringwho を追加。

sen.j: 弁官藤原遠経の孫。
sen.e: The grandson of Benkan (Oversight Department (division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices)) FUJIWARA no Totsune.
He was the grandson of a Benkan (an officer of Oversight Department [division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices]) FUJIWARA no Totsune.
sen.cmt: 文が不完全です。（）内括弧を[]に替えました。弁官はこの場合，役職名としての説明が必要と思われるので，変更を加えました。
sen.e: He was the grandson of FUJIWARA no Totsune who was an officer of Oversight Department (division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices).
sen.cmt: 語順を変更しました。Mまた弁官はローマ字表記は必要ないと判断しました。

sen.j: 大宰府藤原良範の三男。
sen.e: The third son of Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region) FUJIWARA no Yoshinori.
He was the third son of FUJIWARA no Yoshinori, an officer of Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region).
sen.cmt: 文が不完全です。大宰府は機関の名前のため，変更を加えました。
sen.e: He was the third son of FUJIWARA no Yoshinori, an officer of Dazaifu (local government office in Kyushu region).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 弟に藤原純乗がいる。
sen.e: His younger brother was FUJIWARA no Suminori.
FUJIWARA no Suminori was his younger brother.
sen.cmt: 弟の数が不明なので書き換えました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Suminori was his younger brother.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 従五位・伊予国掾。
sen.e: Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) and Iyo-no-kuni no jo (provincial governor of Iyo).
His official rank was Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) and Iyo-no-kuni no jo (provincial governor of Iyo Province).
sen.cmt: 文が不完全です。Iyo Provinceとしました。
sen.e: His official rank was Jugoi (Junior Fifth Rank) and Iyo-no-kuni no jo (provincial governor of Iyo Province).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 瀬戸内海で朝廷に対し反乱を起こしたことで知られる。
sen.e: He is known to have caused a rebellion against the Imperial Court at the Seto Inland Sea.
He is known to have revolted against the Imperial Court on the Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: 「反乱を起こす」の動詞が不適切と思われます。「瀬戸内海で」の前置詞をonに替えました。
sen.e: He is known to have revolted against the Imperial Court on the Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 純友の乱は関東で平将門が起こした乱と併せて承平天慶の乱と呼ばれる。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's War is, along with the rebellion caused by TAIRA no Madakado in the Kanto region, called as the Johei and Tengyo War.
FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's War, along with the rebellion led by TAIRA no Masakado in the Kanto region, is referred to as the Johei and Tengyo War.
sen.cmt: 「反乱を起こす」の動詞およびcalled asが不適切と思われ書き換えました。TAIRA no Madakadoとスペルミスがあります。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's War, along with the rebellion led by TAIRA no Masakado in the Kanto region, is referred to as the Johei and Tengyo War.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 藤原氏の中でもっとも栄えた藤原北家の出身である。
sen.e: Sumitomo was from the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, which was most flourished family among the Fujiwara clan.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sumitomo was from the FUJIWARA Hokke (the Northern House, one of the four FUJIWARA family lines), which was most flourishing family among the four FUJIWARA family lines.
sen.cmt: 藤原家の説明なのでclanよりもfamilyがふさわしいと考えます。"flourishing"と形容詞にしました。
sen.e: Sumitomo was from the FUJIWARA Hokke (the Northern House, one of the four FUJIWARA family lines), which was most flourishing family among the four FUJIWARA family lines.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 大叔父には藤原基経がいる。
sen.e: His great uncle was FUJIWARA no Mototsune.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Mototsune was his great uncle.
sen.cmt: 大叔父の数が不明なので書き換えました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Mototsune was his great uncle.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 早くに父を失い、都での出世は望むべくも無く地方官となる。
sen.e: Since his father died when he was young, he could not hope for successful career at Kyoto, and became a local official.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He had no chance of succeeding in the capital as he had lost his father early, which made him decide to be a local official.
sen.cmt: わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: He had no chance of succeeding in the capital as he had lost his father early, which made him decide to be a local official.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 当初は父の従兄弟である伊予国国司藤原元名に従って伊予掾として、瀬戸内に跋扈する海賊を鎮圧する側にあった。
sen.e: At first, Sumitomo was, following his father's cousin Iyo no kuni kokushi (the provincial governor of Iyo Province) FUJIWARA no Motona, suppressing the pirates in the Setouchi region as Iyo-no-kuni no jo.

Sumitomo initially engaged in suppressing pirates that thrived in the Setouchi region as Iyo-no-kuni no jo, under the direction of his father's cousin FUJIWARA no Motona, Iyo no kuni kokushi (the provincial governor of Iyo Province).
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。「従って」はfollowing よりも「管理下で」の意味がでる熟語に替えました。
sen.e: Sumitomo initially engaged in suppressing pirates that thrived in the Setouchi region as Iyo-no-kuni no jo, under the direction of his father's cousin FUJIWARA no Motona, Iyo no kuni kokushi (the provincial governor of Iyo Province).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: しかしながら、元名帰任後も帰京せず伊予国に土着する。
sen.e: However, even after Motona was back, Sumitomo did not return to Kyoto and stayed in the Iyo Province.
While Motona returned to Kyoto, Sumitomo remained in Iyo Province to settle down.
sen.cmt: "be動詞+back"で帰任と訳するのは難しいと考え書き直しました。
sen.e: While Motona returned to Kyoto, Sumitomo remained in Iyo Province to settle down.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 承平 (日本)6年（936年）頃までには海賊の頭領となった。
sen.e: By the time around 936, he became the Toryo (leader) of the pirates.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He became the chieftain of pirates by around 936.
sen.cmt: 頭領の表現がchieftainのほうが適当と考え変更，海賊の冠詞を省き，時間の表現を書き換えました。
sen.e: He became the chieftain of pirates by around 936.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 伊予（愛媛県）の日振島を根城として千艘以上の船を操って周辺の海域を荒らした。
sen.e: Having the Hiburi Island in the Iyo Province as his headquarters, he controlled more then 1,000 ships to loot the ocean area around there.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: With the Hiburi Island of Iyo Province (present Ehime Prefecture) as his base of operations, he controlled more than 1,000 ships to commit piracy in the surrounding ocean area.
sen.cmt: 「海域を荒らす」の訳を「周辺海域で海賊行為を働く」と判断しました。「根城」の表現を書き換えました。"than"にスペルミスがあります。（愛媛県）が訳漏れです。
sen.e: With the Hiburi Island of Iyo Province (present Ehime Prefecture) as his base of operations, he controlled more than 1,000 ships to commit piracy in the surrounding ocean area.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: やがて瀬戸内海全域に勢力をのばした。
sen.e: Then, he expanded his power to the whole Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Before long he expanded his sphere of influence through the whole area of the Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: 訳文の言葉が少々足りないと考え補いました。
sen.e: Before long he expanded his sphere of influence through the whole area of the Seto Inland Sea.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 関東で平将門が乱を起こした頃とほぼ時を同じくして瀬戸内の海賊を率いて乱を起こした。
sen.e: Around the same time when TAIRA no Masakado made a rebellion in the Kanto region, Sumitomo led the pirates in the Setouchi region and caused a rebellion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Around the same time as the outbreak of the rebellion in the Kanto region led by TAIRA no Masakado, Sumitomo rose in revolt by commanding the pirates in the Setouchi region.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Around the same time as the outbreak of the rebellion in the Kanto region led by TAIRA no Masakado, Sumitomo rose in revolt by commanding the pirates in the Setouchi region.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 藤原純友の勢力は畿内に進出した。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's power extended to the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's influence reached to the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: 勢力と進出を書き換えました。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Sumitomo's influence reached to the Kinai region.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天慶2年（939年）には純友は部下の藤原文元に摂津国須岐駅にて備前国・播磨国の国司（備前介：藤原子高、播磨介：島田惟幹）を襲撃させ、これを捕らえた。
sen.e: In 939, Sumitomo made his subordinate FUJIWARA no Fumimoto to attack and capture the Kokushi (provincial governor) of the Bizen Province and the Harima Province (Bizen no suke (Assistant Governor of Bizen Province): FUJIWARA no Takaiko, and Harima no suke (assistant governor of Harima Province): Koremoto SHIMADA) at the Sukieki in the Settsu Province.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 939, Sumitomo ordered his subordinate FUJIWARA no Fumimoto to attack two members of Kokushi (provincial governor) of the Bizen and Harima provinces (Bizen no suke [Assistant Governor of Bizen Province]: FUJIWARA no Takaiko, and Harima no suke [Assistant governor of Harima Province]: Koremoto SHIMADA) at the Sukieki in Settsu Province, and captured them.
sen.cmt: 使役動詞の使い方に文法上問題があり，書き換えました。
sen.e: In 939, Sumitomo ordered his subordinate FUJIWARA no Fumimoto to attack two members of Kokushi (provincial governor) of the Bizen and Harima provinces (Bizen no suke [Assistant Governor of Bizen Province]: FUJIWARA no Takaiko, and Harima no suke [Assistant governor of Harima Province]: Koremoto SHIMADA) at the Sukieki in Settsu Province, and captured them.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 翌天慶3年（940年）には、2月に淡路国・8月には讃岐国の国府を略奪。
sen.e: In 940, Sumitomo attacked the Awaji Province in February, the Kokufu (ancient provincial office/capital) of the Sanuki Province in August, and finally in October, he attacked Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region) and looted.
In 940, Sumitomo attacked the Kokufu (ancient provincial offices) of the Awaji Province in February, and that of the Sanuki Province in August.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。国府は淡路国，讃岐国の両方にかかると考え書き換えました。
sen.e: In 940, Sumitomo attacked the Kokufu (ancient provincial offices) of the Awaji Province in February, and that of the Sanuki Province in August.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: さらに10月にはついに大宰府を襲撃し略奪を行った。
sen.e: In October of the same year, he finally attacked and looted the Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。"loot"の目的語がないため書き換えました。
sen.e: In October of the same year, he finally attacked and looted the Dazai-fu (local government office in Kyushu region).
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 朝廷は純友追討のために追捕使長官：小野好古、次官：源経基、主典：藤原慶幸・大蔵春実による兵を差し向けた。
sen.e: The Imperial Court sent an army, consisting of ONO no Yoshifuru as the director general of the tsuibushi (Pursuit and Apprehension Agent), MINAMOTO no Tsunemoto as the undersecretary, and FUJIWARA no Yoshiyuki and OKURA no Haruzane as sakan, for the purpose of tracking down and killing Sumitomo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: The Imperial Court ordered Tsuibushi (Pursuit and Apprehension Agent) no kami (the director general) ONO no Yoshifuru, Tsuibushi no suke (the undersecretary) MINAMOTO no Tsunemoto and Tsuibushi no sakan (secretary) FUJIWARA no Yoshiyuki and OKURA no Haruzane to go for tracking down and killing Sumitomo with their troops.
sen.cmt: 訳文だと4人からなる軍に考えられるので書き換えました。役職は個人の官位と考えられますが，asで説明すると派遣時に与えられた役職になってしまいます。書き換えました。
sen.e: The Imperial Court ordered Tsuibushi (Pursuit and Apprehension Agent) no kami (the director general) ONO no Yoshifuru, Tsuibushi no suke (the undersecretary) MINAMOTO no Tsunemoto and Tsuibushi no sakan (secretary) FUJIWARA no Yoshiyuki and OKURA no Haruzane to go for tracking down and killing Sumitomo with their troops.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 天慶4年（941年）5月に博多湾の戦いで、純友の船団は追捕使の軍により壊滅させられた。
sen.e: In May 941, at the battle of the Hakata Bay, Sumitomo's fleet was destroyed by the army of tsuibushi.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In May 941, Sumitomo's fleet was destroyed by the troops commanded by Tsuibushi in the Battle of Hakata Bay.
sen.cmt: 「戦いで」の前置詞をinに替えました。
sen.e: In May 941, Sumitomo's fleet was destroyed by the troops commanded by Tsuibushi in the Battle of Hakata Bay.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 純友は子息の重太丸と伊予国へ逃れたが、同年6月に伊予国警固使橘遠保により捕らえられ、獄中で没した。
sen.e: Sumitomo and his son Shigetamaro escaped to the Iyo Province; however, they were captured by the Keigoshi (envoys to protect) of the Iyo Province TACHIBANA no Toyasu in June of the same year, and died in prison.

Although Sumitomo and his son Shigetamaro took refuge in Iyo Province, they died in prison after being captured by the Keigoshi (envoys to protect) of Iyo Province TACHIBANA no Toyasu in June of the same year.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: Although Sumitomo and his son Shigetamaro took refuge in Iyo Province, they died in prison after being captured by the Keigoshi (envoys to protect) of Iyo Province TACHIBANA no Toyasu in June of the same year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 将門の乱がわずか2ヶ月で平定されたのに対し、純友の乱は2年に及んだ。
sen.e: On the contrary to the fact that the rebellion made by Masakado was settled only in 2 months, Sumitomo's rebellion took 2 years to settle.
In contrast to the rebellion led by Masakado, which was settled within only two months, Sumitomo's war required as long as two years to be settled.
sen.cmt: 多少わかりづらいので書き換えました。
sen.e: In contrast to the rebellion led by Masakado, which was settled within only two months, Sumitomo's war required as long as two years to be settled.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

Furthermore, Tsuibushi is believed to have reported the details of the battle against Sumitomo to the government, which was titled "Sumitomo Tsuito-ki" (a record of how troops tracked down and killed Sumitomo).

sen.e: According to that theory, Sumitomo was the son of Tomohisa TAKAHASHI in the Takahashigo, Imabari City, who was from the local ruling family in the Iyo Province, the Ochi clan, whose ancestor was Oyamatsumi.
